raw_text:
Branson show flops on US screens
 
 Entrepreneur Sir Richard Branson's US TV show, The Rebel Billionaire, is proving a flop in the ratings.
 
 The programme suffered poor viewing figures on its debut on the Fox network three weeks ago, and has lost one in five of its viewers since then. The show is seen as Fox's answer to The Apprentice featuring tycoon Donald Trump, a ratings hit for rivals NBC. Sir Richard's show sees a group of young entrepreneurs compete to become the president of his business empire. The Rebel Billionaire has averaged five million viewers and is 91st in the rankings of all prime-time shows. The Apprentice, which has already completed its first season, is still managing to pull in 16 million viewers, while its prime-time ranking is number four.
 
 But Fox has said it plans to stick with Branson's show throughout its 12-episode run. "It's going to remain on the air," said the network's spokesman Scott Grogin. "Creatively we're extremely pleased with the show and hope the audience will find it," he added. Contestants on Sir Richard's show are confronted with business tasks to solve, similar to The Apprentice. They are also subjected to stunts like walking a plank suspended in mid-air. The Rebel Billionaire has marketed itself as a less materialistic version of The Apprentice, with Sir Richard shown jumping out of a taxi, while Trump is seen in a limousine.
llama3.2:1b: Sir Richard Branson's US TV show "The Rebel Billionaire" is failing to impress viewers on Fox, with poor ratings and only 91st place in prime-time rankings.
Despite its commercial success at home, the show has averaged only five million viewers since debuting three weeks ago, compared to The Apprentice's 16 million viewers for its first season.
llama3.2:3b: Sir Richard Branson's US TV show "The Rebel Billionaire" has poor viewing figures on its debut and has lost one in five viewers since then.
It averages 5 million viewers and ranks 91st in prime-time shows, behind rival "The Apprentice" which pulls in 16 million viewers and is ranked number four.
gemma2:2b: Sir Richard Branson's US TV show "The Rebel Billionaire" is struggling in ratings, losing viewers and ranking 91st in primetime television.
Despite this, Fox plans to air the show throughout its 12-episode run.
The show features entrepreneurs competing for control of Sir Richard's business empire through tasks and challenges similar to "The Apprentice", but with a focus on less materialistic themes.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Sir Richard Branson's US TV show "The Rebel Billionaire" has been criticized for not meeting the expectations set by Fox and NBC's prime-time shows like "The Apprentice."
It has had poor ratings and average viewership compared to its competitors, with only five million viewers seen so far.
The programme focuses on young entrepreneurs competing to become the president of their business empire.
However, Fox plans to stick with it throughout its 12-episode run.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Sir Richard Branson's US TV show, The Rebel Billionaire, is underperforming due to poor ratings and has lost one-fifth of its audience since its debut on Fox three weeks ago.
It aims to compete with NBC's The Apprentice by featuring young entrepreneurs who must run the entrepreneur's empire.
The show, which has averaged 5 million viewers per episode, ranks as low as 91st in all prime-time shows but remains on air according to Fox.
qwen2.5:3b: Entrepreneur Sir Richard Branson's US TV show, The Rebel Billionaire, has struggled in ratings since its debut on Fox three weeks ago.
It averaged five million viewers and ranks 91st among prime-time shows; in contrast, The Apprentice, featuring Donald Trump, still attracts 16 million viewers and is ranked fourth.
Despite poor initial performance, Fox plans to continue airing the show for its full run of 12 episodes.
Similar to The Apprentice, Rebel Billionaire features contestants solving business challenges and participating in stunts like jumping from a taxi rather than using a limousine.
